TD.SPAN: DTS Virtual:X, Free Channels with WatchFree+

and.attribute: 1080p High-Definition - Watch TV in crisp, clear 1080p Full HD resolution and experience a brilliant picture with the VIZIO D-Series.
Full Array LED Backlight - Evenly distributed LEDs across the screen\xe2\x80\x99s backlight deliver superior light uniformity and picture performance.
IQ Picture Processor - Delivers superior picture processing, faster navigation, and quicker load times to get to your favorite content faster.

V-Gaming Engine Automatically optimizes picture mode for gaming and makes next-gen console gameplay more responsive with Auto Game Mode, Variable Refresh Rate with AMD Freesync, D-Series lowest input lag, and newly added gaming menu.
SmartCast - With intuitive navigation, enjoy instant access to the best selection of apps from top-tier streaming services like Netflix, Disney+, YouTube, HBO Max and many more right out of the box.

 4.0 out of 5 stars
 
 Nice picture (coming from a 720p resolution 20 year old Sony).
 


 
 
 
 Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023

and.attribute: \n I bought this TV to replace a smaller 20 year old Sony. It is used in the kitchen.Nice picture (coming from a 720p resolution 20 year old Sony). Nice feature set in terms of being \'smart\'. I was able to modify an adjustable height monitor stand that I already had so I could mount the new set. As you can see, my kitchen cabinets limited my overall height. I was able to mount the new sound bar underneath the tv and made a nice compact package. Make sure you buy a set with the inputs and outputs you need. There are many choices and the more features there are, the higher the price. This was fine for what I needed.\n

subtree.DIV: \n

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: The best purchase I could\xe2\x80\x99ve made

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023

DIV.DIV: I grew up as someone who only received tv\xe2\x80\x99s through family members who could afford new ones and had to give away their old one. This is the first time I actually bought a TV brand new. My old ones HDMI ports were going bad, and I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t connect anything to it anymore. I was really trying to find a cheap option, and I most definitely found a really good one. I had a firestick, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t need it anymore since this TV came with all streaming services by default, as well as a free cable service with a ton of channels to watch! You also download an app where you can use a Bluetooth remote, and go through all the apps you have. The picture quality is amazing! I was iffy because it was 1080p and not 4k, but I most definitely underestimated it. Not only has this Tv exceeded my expectations, but it also also eased my conscience in knowing that I made a good decision in purchasing this (it isn\xe2\x80\x99t often I\xe2\x80\x99m blowing more than $100 on something that isn\xe2\x80\x99t a bill lol). If you made it this far in reading, thank you, and know that you will also love this tv, hopefully as much as I do

24 people found this helpful




 Helpful
 
 
 Report

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: You get what you pay for

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023

DIV.DIV: I am a long time VIZIO user. This TV replaced a more expensive model that had an "accident". I see little , if any, difference in the picture (excellent) or sound quality (lousy). There are fewer bells and whistles - only two HDMI ports, the sound bars must be plugged into the headphone jack, and the set-up is a little quirky. If you want the good stuff, buy a better model. For the price, this an excellent TV.

3 people found this helpful




 Helpful
 
 
 Report

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Great picture quality from Vizio but is reliability there?

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023

DIV.DIV: I purchased this item October 12 2022 new from Amazon. Tv looks great and picture quality is outstanding! Today is March 9 2023. I seem to be having issues with the tv turning on when it likes to from time to time. Maybe something to do with the remote. I\xe2\x80\x99m unsure and changed the batteries already but problem persists. Today I have heard some crackling sound from the tv when it was off. I ran into the living room and notice it was coming from the back. Unsure if it was through the tvs built in speakers or something electrical inside the tv. I turned the tv back on and off and the sound stopped. Tv seems to be working ok but I\xe2\x80\x99m getting concerned for this product. This is my first Vizio tv and I have always owned Samsung. Never ran into any problems with my past tvs. I will contact Vizio customer service and discuss this matter.

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Great Value!

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023

DIV.DIV: Got this for $175 which I think is a steal for a Vizio in this size! Great picture and decent sound, none of the muffled sound others complain about in their reviews. We didn't like how wobbly the feet out of the box were so we got a $20 mount stand off Amazon and it's perfect!

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Good little TV but there's no channel guide.

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2023

DIV.DIV: It's a good size for the bedroom and has a great picture. But we use it for streaming and have antenna, no cable. It scanned and picked up lots of channels but because there's no guide on the TV I have to click each channel to see what's on. Kind of annoying, but I use it mostly to stream so it's not a deal breaker.

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Decent compact TV

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023

DIV.DIV:
Bought this to replace an earlier model Vizio whose audio had become unreliable. This TV is wall mounted and size was the number one criterion for the replacement. It fits the standard VESA mounting bracket. This TV is connected to our cable box (HDMI connection), so we don't use a lot of its built-in network capabilities (not its own remote).
It did fix our issue with sound cutting out, but it has all the audio quality of a tin can on a string. Use of an inexpensive sound bar is highly recommended.

Stand, TV, Remote Control, Power Cable

and.attribute: 4K UltraHD delivers more than four times the resolution of a regular 1080p highdefinition screen. Along with over 8.3 million pixels, inside you'll find a powerful full array LED backlight at work creating a sharper, more colorful picture.
Kick back and enjoy streaming movies and TV episodes, plus live-streaming news, TV, sports and more, across thousands of free and paid channels with the Roku TV Operating System.

Quickly access entertainment and control your TV with a Google Assistant or Alexa device (sold separately). With the touch of your remote or Roku mobile app, or a simple voice command, you can take control of your smart home, turn on and off the TV, change channels, and much more.

Dolby Vision HDR and HDR10 transforms your TV into an entertainment powerhouse. The image technology from cinemas, now brought together in the home, provide amazing realism that you'll see, hear, and feel like never before.
Motion Rate 120 image processing technology allows you to enjoy fast-paced sports, movies, and 4K gaming without the lag.
Dimensions (with the stand): 57.2 by 35.3 by 11.5 inches, 36.8 pounds.
Ports: 3 HDMI, HDMI CED/HDMI ARC, Ethernet, 1 USB 2.0, 1 RF Antenna, 1 RCA Composite Video Input, 1 L/R Audio Input for Composite, 1 Optical Digital Audio Output, 1 Earphone/Audio Output.

and.attribute: \n I just got this and im very happy with it. Extremely easy setup and very inexpensive. I know you can spend a lot of money on other brands but this was 399 and I love it. This is actually a very nice tv.\n

subtree.DIV: \n

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Perfect TV for older people

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2023

DIV.DIV:
I love this TV and I love that Amazon offers a set up service. The people showed up on time (even called saying they were 5 min away) and completely set up the new TV and removed the boxing.
I\xe2\x80\x99m older and what I like most about this 65\xe2\x80\x9d TV is that now I can read the captions and movie descriptions which I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t on my previous 55\xe2\x80\x9d tv.
The picture is great and it is easy to use. I would definitely recommend this size TV and the delivery unpacking service offered from Amazon.

3 people found this helpful




 Helpful
 
 
 Report

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: AWESOME TV AT THIS PRICE POINT!!!

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2023

DIV.DIV:
I purchased the Hisense 43R6G 4K Roku smart TV and I could not be happier. The size, 43" is perfect for the space. For a Tv in the budget class this TV Iis an overachiever.
First, I have had Roku streaming boxes for over 10 years so set up was no problem. I believe it took about 10 minutes or less and it was up and running.
The picture is excellent. The design is clean and modern. It is almost perfect.
A couple of quibbles. First, all I will say about the sound is it comes out of the speakers. I did purchase a budget Hisense soundbar and glad I did.
Secondly, the remote. When I point it at the TV, it's like playing Duck Hunt. I never know where to point it because the "spot" keeps moving. Unless I point the remote at the wall behind me. The TVlikes the bank shot; works every time.
This TV is too good to not give it 5 stars though. It is an awesome product.

21 people found this helpful




 Helpful

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Buy it

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023

DIV.DIV:
Packaging was intact. Tv is doing what it\xe2\x80\x99s supposed to do! Had my Tv since October2022 it\xe2\x80\x99s now April2023 I\xe2\x80\x99m very pleased with the purchase!
Had a little issue with the package being missing,found out my neighbor brung it inside his home while I was at work to prevent theft,but he had it for almost 2days before saying something makes me go Hmmmm. I had already been in contact with authorities as instructed to do so by AMAZON,nevertheless I notified both parties once the package had been returned/found.

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: 50" Roku tv. Just one remote now!

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023

DIV.DIV:
Great easy to set up and use 50" roku tv. No damage. My first 4k tv. Great picture easy to use settings. Did connect my sound bar thru HDMI arc so only need to use the roku remote for both.
Only had for a few weeks and hope it lasts. I like the roku operating system better than the amazon fire. Very easy to navigate. Has both 2ghz and 5 for WiFi connection. Only 3 HDMI and one of them is arc. I only needed 2. Very happy with this tv so far.

DIV.A: best for streaming

DIV.DIV: The Roku software works well for streaming, but it is not ideal for local channels with an antenna. The remote does not have number buttons so the only way to change channels is to go to the guide or favorites menu and scroll.

and.attribute: 4K Ultra High Definition: More pixels on the screen produces a more clear and succinct picture making content look more realistic and true to life. Combined with Hisense\'s AI UHD Upscaler , non 4K content will get enhanced to near 4K quality.

Google TV: The entertainment you love. With a little help from Google. Google TV brings together movies, shows, live TV and more from across your apps and subscriptions and organizes them just for you.

Dolby Vision HDR and HDR10: Innovative visual technology, Dolby Vision, brings the characters to life with darker darks, brighter brights , and a remarkable color range you can\'t get anywhere else. HDR10 is an HDR format that delivers HDR content via compatible over the air signals.

Game Mode Plus: A collection of technologies come together to create a dynamic gaming experience. A 60Hz panel, variable refresh rate, and auto low latency mode makes sure that the television can handle the rigors of next generation gaming consoles.

Sports Mode: With sports mode\'s preset settings, the television automatically adjusts itself to optimize sports content. Motion is smoother and color is adjusted for the best sports experience the television is capable of.

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: It's an OK TV so far

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States \xf0\x9f\x87\xba\xf0\x9f\x87\xb8 on March 10, 2023

DIV.DIV: I like the size and the price but reason for the three star is the live TV, I did a scan of local tv channels and some that it picked up are so weak that the signal comes in and out and I wanted to Delete the weak channels that didn't come in strong but after going through the settings I can not find anywhere to delete the channels I do not want or the ones that have a weak signal. One other thing I've noticed is at times the screen will go dim when using as a PC monitor but if I move the mouse it brightens back up now this could be a setting that needs changed but so far I'm not sure what needs to be changed. Update added a Star because after upgrading my Antenna channels got better and after many day I was able to remove the unwanted channels which I found no info on how to do so now one last thing the Program guide for OTA live TV never shows the program or any information but If I change the channel manualy the info like name of program and the time ends so on pops right up. this may not be the Tv"s fault but it sure is a disappointment.

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Make sure screen is not broken.

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States \xf0\x9f\x87\xba\xf0\x9f\x87\xb8 on April 2, 2023

DIV.DIV: I received the Hisense smart tv in a reasonable amount of time, so shipping was fine. I opened the box and removed the plastic and foam, gently laid the tv on a flat surface installed the feet, stood it up, then step back and looked at the screen. First thing I noticed was the bubble with a crack through it on the screen, so I packed it back up and got another tv with my refund sold by best buy through Amazon, which allowed me to pick it up myself and has been good ever since. I got a nice Toshiba smart fire tv.

Helpful
 
 
 Report

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Hisense 43A6H is a very good 43 inch 4k smart TV for a low price.

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States \xf0\x9f\x87\xba\xf0\x9f\x87\xb8 on July 26, 2022

DIV.DIV:
\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n \n Several labels on and in the box warn that the actual screen should not be touched when lifting the TV out of the box, or when moving it around, because the panel can be cracked easily under direct pressure from a strong grip. This actually applies to most new TVs.
I carefully held the TV by the thin frame when moving it around. It is very light at 15 pounds, however.
Feet are about 33 inches apart. Easy to wall mount.
I use the Hisense 43A6H primarily as a computer monitor, and for occasional TV or movie watching. 43 inches is a great size monitor for people with vision problems.
Viewed from 4 feet away, I could not see any pixels. The 4K resolution allows text to appear very smooth on the screen.
The IPS panel allows viewing from wider angles without the picture becoming dimmer - unlike VA panels which become dimmer when viewed from wide angles.
The remote control has a large flat base, so it can stand vertically on a table. There are no number buttons on the remote control to directly choose a channel. The 123 button on the remote can be used to easily access a TV channel if one does not want to use the microphone - or if one does not want to repeatedly press the channel up/down button.
I recently discovered TubiTV online, so I appreciate having a dedicated button for it on the remote control.
The picture is easy to adjust. There are more video calibration controls and audio controls than I expected for a budget 4K television, but the colors seemed accurate out of the box.
Bluetooth easily pairs the TV with the remote control and wireless headphones.
There is a low blue light setting in the picture advanced settings menu. This minimizes eye strain when looking at the TV for long periods of time.
Tech Steve has a good video showing how to use the variable refresh rate feature for video game consoles. The video is at the bottom of the Amazon page for this TV. Thanks, Steve.
Sound is typical small TV speaker sound, but not screechy. I use a receiver to send audio to speakers next to the TV.
There is a headphone jack as well as a digital optical audio out jack.
The tuner picked up more than 100 over the air channels in the SF Bay area, using a flat indoor antenna taped to the window.
The 1080p and 720p over the air signals looked great. Blu-Ray discs looked stunning.
Casting from a phone was easy.
The streaming apps worked fine, using both Wi-Fi and wired ethernet. Extra apps can be downloaded from google through the TV. The first time I turned on the TV, it automatically tried to connect to the internet via Wi-Fi. I prefer the wired ethernet connection for reliability reasons.
The two USB ports each can support 128 Gigabyte USB memory sticks as well as 8 Terabyte hard drives - as long as they are in either NTSF or FAT32 formats.
One of the three HDMI 2.0 ports has eARC.
The Easy Setup guide in the box is actually a 24 page booklet, all in English. A more detailed multi-language e-manual can be viewed on the TV or downloaded onto a computer.
For privacy reasons, I have not signed up for the built-in Google assistant app yet - and because I wanted to see how the TV performed without the Google or Alexa voice feature. So I have not tried the voice control on the remote control. The TV works fine if the microphone and Google TV features are not used.
*
I am very happy with this budget 4K television. No stuck pixels. Easy to set up. It worked fine right out of the box.
Highly recommended.\n \n

H1.SPAN: Westinghouse 24" HD Small TV, Slim, Compact 720p LED Flat Screen TV with Built-in HDMI, USB, VGA, and V-Chip, High Definition 24 Inch TV and Monitor for Home or Office, 2022 Model

A.class: a-popover-trigger a-declarative

and.attribute: High Definition Entertainment - Enjoy a range of vivid colors and crisp visual details with our 24-inch Westinghouse TV. This TV LED backlit screen has reduced motion blur with 720p HD resolution for an immersive viewing experience.

Built-In High-Speed HDMI Cable - With HDMI and USB inputs, you can connect your streaming stick or media player easily to this 24 in TV. Binge-watch your favorite shows or movies with true HD images and sounds using one convenient cable.

Cable & Antenna Connectivity - Access free over-the-air broadcasts by connecting your antenna to this flat screen HD TV, or connect the cable box for your satellite dish. It also supports DVD and HD video game consoles for quick, convenient playing.

Parental Control Features - Monitor what your kids are watching with our 24" TV. The built-in V-chip of this TV for bedroom allows parents/guardians to block content based on program ratings and check on the parental guidelines of unfamiliar shows.

Excellent, Space-Saving Design - The compact, flexible design of this small flat screen TV will fit in any small space from your office, kids\xe2\x80\x99 room, garage, or kitchen. It can be used as an alternative home office monitor, too.

Amazon Customer
 

 1.0 out of 5 stars
 
 MISS LEADING PICTURES/MISINFORMATION | DOES NOT COME WITH FULL COMPONENT CONNECTION and others!
 


 
 
 
 Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2022

and.attribute: \n Unboxed, ...and severely disappointed it wasn\'t the same tv from the pictures. It did not have component which was one of the main reasons and the whole layout of the ports are different. It also did not have optical, as well so I DID NOT GET WHAT I PAID FOR. I will keep this tv since I did pay for a product in the first place and this is the only one I have received. Even though this happened I did see if it did work and it does and looks really not bad out of box, but sound is horrible. For $120 considering the pictures has more ports/inputs and does not come with them, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO SAVE MONEY AND LOOK FOR OTHER OPTIONS.\n

subtree.DIV: \n

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Good value

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023

DIV.DIV: This was a replacement for the bedroom. The main reason for this brand was it has a built in dvd player. Very difficult to find these televisions with that option. The color is brite and crisp very thin edges. The sound is good just would like a bit more control over the sound to adjust the bass, treble etc. It does have it just would like more options. The price is right in comparison to brands similar without a dvd player. Over all a good value. The item shipped arrived two days earlier, and was packed well.

2 people found this helpful




 Helpful

A.class: a-size-base a-link-normal review-title a-color-base review-title-content a-text-bold

DIV.A: Good if you have older components

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023

DIV.DIV: If you need RCA (RWY) inputs, this has them, as well as HDMI and cable. If you don't need a smart TV, this is a good choice. The sound isn't very loud. I had to hook it up to speakers. The picture is nice. Some reviews mention a built-in DVD player. There is none in this model.

DIV.A: Great TV at a great price!

DIV.SPAN: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023

DIV.DIV: This is a TV that I keep on a little table in my bedroom. It doesn't take up a lot of space. It's usually at least 10 feet from me and I can always hear it very well. The setup was easy, and hooked up to a good digital antenna it pulls in over thirty channels in my urban location. Picture quality is crisp and clear. If the need arose, I would buy another one of these, which is high praise from me because I'm usually pretty critical of things that I buy.
